thread.title: Blackshell, Everett indicted in Genesee St. shooting
thread.title_full: Blackshell, Everett indicted in Genesee St. shooting

author: democratandchronicle.com
title: Blackshell, Everett indicted in Genesee St. shooting
text:
Johnny Blackshell and Jalen Everett, two men suspected in the triple homicide on Genesee Street in August , have been indicted by a grand jury. Blackshell , 21, of Chili, and Everett , 20, of Rochester, both face three first-degree murder charges and assault and weapons charges in connection with the shootings in front of the Boys & Girls Club on Aug. 19 that left three people dead and four others wounded.
Johnny Blackshell (Photo: Provided byRochester Police Department)
Blackshell and Everett were also indicted on six counts of second-degree murder, four counts of first-degree assault, second-degree assault, and two counts of second-degree criminal possession of a weapon by the grand jury on Friday.
They are scheduled to be arraigned at 9:30 a.m. Friday.
Blackshell was on parole when he was arrested Aug. 24 less than a week after the shootings that killed Raekwon Manigault, Johnny Johnson, and Jonah Barley.
Blackshell was charged then with illegal weapons possession and possession of stolen property. Police announced days later that they had arrested a suspect in the killings, but were holding him on other charges as the investigation continued.
More: Coverage of the triple homicide on Genesee St.
ROCHESTER DEMOCRAT AND CHRONICLE
Second man arrested in Genesee St. shooting
Buy Photo Jalen Everett, 20, of Rochester pleaded not guilty in City Court to first-degree murder. He is accused of being involved in the shooting deaths of three people on Genesee Street in August. TINA MACINTYRE-YEE, @tyee23/staff photographer Buy Photo Fullscreen Buy Photo Everett was arrested by the Rochester police at the Buffalo Airport trying to leave the state and was held and faces charges in another incident. TINA MACINTYRE-YEE, @tyee23/staff photographer Buy Photo Fullscreen Buy Photo Everett bends forward while his lawyer whispers something to him during Everett's murder arraignment. TINA MACINTYRE-YEE, @tyee23/staff photographer Buy Photo Fullscreen Buy Photo Jalen Everett in court. TINA MACINTYRE-YEE, @tyee23/staff photographer Buy Photo Fullscreen Buy Photo Families of the three killed in the shooting gather outside court after the arraignment of the second man allegedly involved. TINA MACINTYRE-YEE, @tyee23/staff photographer Buy Photo Fullscreen Like this topic? You may also like these photo galleries: Replay Autoplay Show Thumbnails Show Captions Last Slide Next Slide Everett was arrested on Sept. 29 at the Buffalo Airport as he was attempting to leave the state, according to Rochester Police Chief Michael Ciminelli.
Everett, who has been in custody since then, was charged with fourth-degree criminal possession of stolen property relating to a laptop computer.
Blackshell was also indicted on unrelated robbery charges. He was indicted with his sister Shalesha Blackshell, 22, and Joseph Lowry, 21 for an August robbery on Electric Avenue. They were each indicted of first-degree robbery, two counts of second-degree robbery, and second-degree assault.
Both Blackshells and Lowry will be arraigned at 9:30 a.m. Friday.

Johnny Blackshell faces new robbery charges
WCLEVELAND@Gannett.com
